titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the postcard album 'Egypt and Palestine' from the Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref164
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Emily Broad

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 19:05:01 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: 'Egypt and Palestine' postcard album - Hisham Khatib Collection

physdesc.extent: 94 postcards over 50 pages of an album

did.unittitle: The front cover of the album "Egypt and Palestine" with floral embossing.
The inside front cover of the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
From the top down: A postcard of the Ras-El-Tin Lighthouse, a hand-colored postcard of the Ramleh Station in Alexandria, and a postcard of Mehemet-Ali Palace and Mansheya Square in Alexandria.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: A hand-colored postcard of Pompey's Pillar and the Sphinx in Alexandria. Bottom: a postcard of Fairhaven Hotel in Palais Ramleh, Alexandria.

From the top down: a postcard of the Fairhaven Hotel in Palais Ramleh, Alexandria; a postcard showing a general view of the harbor at Port Said; and (No.333) a hand-colored postcard of ships in the Suez Canal.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: From the top down: a hand-colored postcard of men by tents in the desert; a hand-colored postcard of a man ploughing with cattle; and a postcard of a group of people crossing a bridge with a camel, with a man riding a donkey in the background.
Top: a hand-colored postcard of a women on a carriage and a man standing in Egypt. Bottom: [No.66] a hand-colored postcard of a man and a woman with a donkey.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: From the top down: a man guiding a camel over a bridge, a hand-colored postcard of people beside the Nile, and a hand-colored postcard of boats on the bank of the Nile.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: a hand-colored postcard of a group of people sitting under a date palm (Equipage Égyptien). Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of a family with a camel and donkey.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: a painted postcard of a street in Egypt. Bottom: a painted postcard of women and a boy in an alleyway.

From the top down: A postcard of a group walking near a town on the banks of the Nile, a hand-colored postcard of boys and men with water buffalos in the Nile during a flood, and a hand-colored postcard of a man and a boy working with sugarcane.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: a hand-colored postcard of a group of water carriers, Cairo. Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of a woman seated with two scribes.

Top: a hand-colored postcard of a man holding a smoking pipe/shisha in regional dress (Fumeur de Hachiche). Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of a carriage and two men walking in front of it in Saïs, Egypt.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: a hand-colored postcard of two people in front of an ornate doorway in Egypt. Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of Sheikh el-Anwar's house, Cairo.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: A hand-colored postcard of a woman from Cairo wearing regional dress.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: From the top down: a hand-colored postcard of a caravan of camels near the Great Pyramids, a view of the City of the Dead and the Mosque of Sultan al-Ashraf Qaytbay, and a hand-colored postcard of the Mosque-Madrassa of Sultan Hassan and Al-Rifa'i Mosque.
Top: a postcard of the City of the Dead and the Funerary Complex of Sultan al-Ashraf Barsbay. Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of the Aqsunqur Mosque (Blue Mosque) in Cairo.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: A blank page in the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
From the top down: a view of the Shahin Al-Khalwati mosque, and two views of tombs and mausoleums in the Southern Cemetery, City of the Dead, Cairo.
Three views of the road leading to the Great Pyramids of Giza.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Three views of the Great Pyramids of Giza.
Three views of the Great Pyramids of Giza.
Three views of the Great Sphinx of Giza.
From the top down: a hand-colored postcard of the Church of the Epiphany in Port Said, a landscape of Al Qantara, and a hand-colored postcard showing a panoramic view of Cairo.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Two views of boats on the Nile river. The top is a postcard showing a dahabeya and the bottom is a painting of a felucca.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Three hand-colored postcards from the top down: two feluccas on the Nile, (No. 36) the Aswan Dam, and a boat on the Nile.
Top: a hand-colored postcard of the obelisk at Heliopolis. Bottom: a painting of an alleyway.
From the top down: a hand-colored postcard of a caravan, a hand-colored postcard of the harbor and Maison Hollandaise in Port Said, and drawings of ancient Egyptians on leather.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: a painting of the Great Sphinx of Giza. Bottom: a postcard of the entrance to the canal at Port Said.
Top: a view of three feluccas sailing during sunset. Bottom: a postcard of the National Hotel on Suleyman Pasha Street (now Talaat Harb Street), Cairo.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Lévy Fils et cie, Paris-Versailles (France) (Active circa 1872–1900)

did.unittitle: Top: (No. 893) a hand-colored postcard of a group of men making a fire. Bottom: (No.776) a hand-colored postcard of women and children in a village.
From the top down: a postcard of the Channel Company offices in Port Said, (No.6) a postcard of the Qasr-El-Nil Bridge in Cairo and a hand-colored postcard of Zahlé and Mount Lebanon.
A painting of people selling bread at a market.
A painted postcard of people on a hillside in the Upper Kidron Valley.
From the top down: verso of a postcard, a postcard of the Tombs of the Kings in Jerusalem, and a hand-colored postcard of a man carrying water in a village near Cairo.
A panoramic postcard of the Dome of the Rock and Al-Aqsa Compound.
Top: (No.2) a hand-colored postcard showing an interior view of the Pool of Bethesda. Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of the Gate of Judgement (Seventh Station) in the Via Dolorosa.
Top: (No.18) a hand-colored postcard of St. Stephen's Gate (Lions' Gate) in Jerusalem Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of the Fifth Station of the Via Dolorosa.
Top: a painted postcard of the front courtyard of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Bottom: (No.3) a hand-colored postcard of the ruins of St. Anne's Church near the Pool of Bethesda.
Top: a hand-colored postcard of a crowd in the courtyard of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Bottom: a hand-colored postcard of a general view of Jerusalem and the Jerusalem Railway Station.

From the top down: a hand-colored postcard of the Church of the Dormition, a hand-colored postcard showing the landscape of Siloam (Silwan), and (No.10) a postcard of oil lamps in a museum near St. Anne's Church, Jerusalem (including a Biblical reference).
Three hand-colored postcards from the top down: a group of tinsmiths in their shop in Cairo, the Avenue of the Sphinxes in Luxor, and a landscape of Raouché (Pigeons' Rock), Beirut.
Top: a postcard of the Tree of Virgin Mary in Al Matariyyah, Cairo. Bottom: a postcard of a painting of two men in regional dress, caption is verse Micah 7:14.

Top: a postcard of a painting of men fishing in the Sea of Galilee, with sailboats in the background; caption is verse Matt 4:18 and John 11:3. Bottom: a postcard of a landscape of Tiberias and the coast of the Sea of Galilee.
A hand-colored postcard of the "Eighth Pylon of Heaven" in the Temple of Amun-Re, Karnak.
A painting of a group of people near the Sphinx and the Great Pyramids.
A painting of the Colossi of Memnon with people in the foreground in Luxor, Egypt.
A blank page in the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
A blank page in the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
The back cover of the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
A blank page in the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
A blank page in the Album "Egypt and Palestine."
